findings.title: Membership#transferOwner() function works abnormally
findings.description: The transferOwner() function does not work as intended.

findings.title: User Unable to Take Assigned Token via LOKA#take() Function
findings.description: When calling LOKA#allocate() function, it does not check whether totalSupply + amount is less than ERC20Capped#_cap. Thus, at the time when LOKA#take() function is called, if totalSupply + amount exceeds ERC20Capped#_cap, the call becomes reverted.

findings.title: There are missing Events
findings.description: Without Event, it is difficult to identify in real-time whether correct values are recorded on the blockchain.

findings.title: There are functions not in use
findings.description: Unused functions were found in the contract.

findings.title: Unprotected Minting in LOKA#take() Function
findings.description: The LOKA#take() function mints tokens allocated from LOKA#allocate() without checking if totalSupply + amount exceeds ERC20Capped#_cap, potentially causing reverts and preventing users from taking allocated tokens.

findings.title: There are missing Events
findings.description: The mint function lacks the Mint event, making it difficult to identify correct values recorded on the blockchain and determine whether corresponding functions have been called.
